entry.title: Government eliminates major conscription law loophole

media:group.media:title: Government eliminates major conscription law loophole
media:group.media:description:
üìç In a significant move to reduce government spending, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan's initiative to cut official vehicles has so far resulted in at least a 38% reduction in the state vehicle fleet. üìç Yerevan Mayor Tigran Avinyan announced that his father has filed a lawsuit against CivilNet over a corruption investigation. üìç Armenia's government today approved amendments to close a loophole in military service regulations that allowed conscripts to indefinitely postpone their service through repeated one-year medical deferrals.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

media:group.media:title: Armenia's evolving military capabilities
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the Civilnet Podcast, APRI fellow and military analyst Leonid Nersisyan provides an in-depth assessment of the ongoing reforms and developments within Armenia's armed forces. Nersisyan delves into the country's recent defense procurement and training initiatives with France and India, as well as the steps Armenia is taking to counter Azerbaijan's military capabilities. The discussion offers insights into the evolving security landscape in the South Caucasus and the strategic considerations shaping Armenia's military modernization efforts.

entry.title: Arpine Sargsyan's rise to Armenia's Interior Ministry

media:group.media:title: Arpine Sargsyan's rise to Armenia's Interior Ministry
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of Insights, host Eric Hacopian offers a comprehensive analysis of the landmark appointment of Arpine Sargsyan as Armenia's new Interior Minister. Sargsyan's rise to the position represents a significant milestone for female leadership in the country, shattering long standing glass ceilings in the traditionally male-dominated realm of law enforcement and national security. Hacopian delves into the political implications of Sargsyan's appointment, exploring the challenges and opportunities it presents for Armenia's ongoing democratic development and efforts to promote greater gender equality in positions of authority.

entry.title: Aurora panel explores solutions to global health crises

media:group.media:title: Aurora panel explores solutions to global health crises
media:group.media:description:
A discussion on the global healthcare crisis took place during the Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in Los Angeles in May 2024. Organized by the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative in partnership with UCLA‚Äôs The Promise Institute for Human Rights, the conversation was moderated by Alice Park, Senior Health Correspondent at TIME. Panelists included recording artist, biotech entrepreneur, and Co-Founder of Major Inc., Aloe Blacc; CEO of Catholic Medical Mission Board, Mary Beth Powers; UN Special Rapporteur on the Right to Health, Tlaleng Mofokeng; Director at USC‚Äôs Institute on Inequalities in Global Health, Sofia Gruskin; and CEO of Partners in Health, Sheila Davis. Together, they explored pressing challenges in global healthcare, including access to care, systemic inequalities, and the role of innovation and advocacy in creating sustainable solutions.

media:group.media:title: Armenia reopens embassy in Syria
media:group.media:description:
üìç The lower house of Switzerland‚Äôs parliament passed a motion calling for the country to host a Nagorno-Karabakh peace forum. üìç Prosecutors in Azerbaijan have referred a criminal case to the Baku Military Court against many of the former Nagorno-Karabakh officials and prisoners currently held in Baku. üìç Armenia's Foreign Ministry announced the resumption of diplomatic mission operations in Syria‚Äôs capital Damascus. üìç Armenia‚Äôs parliamentary speaker, Alen Simonyan, met with his Indian counterpart Jagdeep Dhankhar during his visit to New Delhi, to discuss bilateral relations. üìç A look into Georgia's democratic backsliding: https://youtu.be/ql0tynUGVMU?si=KB6ql9hmr8Zo2baI
